title: How to Make Chocolate Chip Cookies

steps.title: Preheat the oven
steps.content: Preheat the oven to 375°F/190°C.

steps.title: Combine flour, salt, and baking soda in a medium bowl.
steps.content: Combine flour, salt, and baking soda in a medium bowl. To reduce clumpiness, sift through a sifter or sieve. Gently mix these together, then set the bowl aside.

steps.title: Beat the butter and sugar together in a large bowl, then beat in eggs and vanilla extract.
steps.content: Beat the butter and sugar together in a large bowl, then beat in eggs and vanilla extract. The coarseness of the sugar granules will help break the butter down, so be sure to do this first. Then add the eggs and vanilla and mix again until completely combined.

steps.title: Gradually a cup at a time add the dry ingredients from the medium bowl to the wet ingredients in the large bowl, then add chocolate chips.
steps.content: Gradually a cup at a time add the dry ingredients from the medium bowl to the wet ingredients in the large bowl, then add chocolate chips. Pour a cup of the dry ingredients, stir, and repeat until the dry and wet ingredients are totally combined. Fold the chocolate chips in until fully incorporated. At this point you should have a moderately thick cookie dough. Do not over-stir the dough. While the dry ingredients should be added gradually, don’t do so little at a time that your dough turns to brick. Aim for adding the dry ingredients in four or five batches.

steps.title: Drop spoonfuls of cookie dough onto a pre-greased or a lined baking sheet.
steps.content: Drop spoonfuls of cookie dough onto a pre-greased or a lined baking sheet. Leave at least an inch of space between the cookies because they'll spread out when they bake. You can usually fit 12 cookies on a full-sized cookie sheet at a time.

steps.title: Bake for about 10 minutes or until barley golden brown around the edges.
steps.content: Bake for about 10 minutes or until barley golden brown around the edges. Do not over bake; if you do the cookies will be dark brown and burnt. Remove the pan from the oven and let the cookies rest on the pan for 10 minutes. This will cook the cookie thoroughly while they will remain chewy.

steps.title: Let cool for about 5-7 minutes.
steps.content: Let cool for about 5-7 minutes. Using a spatula, lift cookies off and place onto wax paper, a plate, or a cooling rack.

steps.title: Go ahead and eat!
steps.content: Go ahead and eat! Eat when hot and steamy or cooled and slightly crisp. If you like you can pipe a small swirl of icing or whipping cream on top and add some sprinkles to make it look fancy.

steps.title: Preheat the oven
steps.content: Preheat the oven to 350ºF/180ºC.

steps.title: Add the vanilla, sugar, brown sugar, eggs, and butter.
steps.content: Add the vanilla, sugar, brown sugar, eggs, and butter. Use coarser sugar for thicker, chewier cookies. When sugar dissolves, it acts as a tenderizer that interferes with dough structure. This increases spreading because finer sugar dissolves more easily than coarser sugar. So if you want your cookies to remain thick and chewy, use coarse sugar (or use fine sugar for the opposite effect). If you decide to use powdered sugar for extra crispiness, make sure it doesn't have corn starch in it, or you'll get unexpected results. [1] X Research source Mix these ingredients until creamy.

steps.title: Add the flour, salt, and baking soda/powder.
steps.content: Add the flour, salt, and baking soda/powder.

steps.title: Mix until fully blended; add the milk to achieve a smoothly blended dough.
steps.content: Mix until fully blended; add the milk to achieve a smoothly blended dough. After blending the mixture, add the chocolate chips.

steps.title: Apply cooking spray to the pan so that the cookies won't stick to the baking pan.
steps.content: Apply cooking spray to the pan so that the cookies won't stick to the baking pan. Alternatively, line the pan with baking paper.

steps.title: Roll a small ball for each cookie.
steps.content: Roll a small ball for each cookie.

steps.title: Place the cookie balls on the baking pan.
steps.content: Place the cookie balls on the baking pan.

steps.title: Flatten each cookie with a fork.
steps.content: Flatten each cookie with a fork. This will leave distinct ridges and flatten the cookie neatly.

steps.title: Put cookies in the oven for about 8-10 minutes or until light golden brown.
steps.content: Put cookies in the oven for about 8-10 minutes or until light golden brown. Don't overdo the cooking, as they'll continue to cook after you remove them from the oven.

steps.title: Take the cookies out of the oven and let them sit on a wire cooling rack for about 15 minutes to cool.
steps.content: Take the cookies out of the oven and let them sit on a wire cooling rack for about 15 minutes to cool. Be careful not to burn yourself on the melted chips when transferring the cookies to the rack - use a spatula. The cookies are ready to eat when the chocolate chips solidify again.

steps.title: Store in an airtight container, or eat the cookies once they've cooled.
steps.content: Store in an airtight container, or eat the cookies once they've cooled.

steps.title: Oil your cookie sheet lightly as you preheat the oven to 350°F/180°C.
steps.content: Oil your cookie sheet lightly as you preheat the oven to 350°F/180°C.

steps.title: Mix together the flour, salt, and baking soda in a medium bowl.
steps.content: Mix together the flour, salt, and baking soda in a medium bowl.

steps.title: Cream together the margarine, brown sugar, sugar, vanilla and egg replacer mixture in a large bowl.
steps.content: Cream together the margarine, brown sugar, sugar, vanilla and egg replacer mixture in a large bowl.

steps.title: Stir the flour mixture into the wet ingredients and mix until the ingredients are well combined.
steps.content: Stir the flour mixture into the wet ingredients and mix until the ingredients are well combined.

steps.title: Add the chocolate chips and mix them into the batter.
steps.content: Add the chocolate chips and mix them into the batter.

steps.title: Drop the dough by spoonfuls onto the cookie sheet and bake them for 8 to 10 minutes.
steps.content: Drop the dough by spoonfuls onto the cookie sheet and bake them for 8 to 10 minutes.

steps.title: Cool the vegan chocolate chip cookies on a wire rack once you take them out the oven.
steps.content: Cool the vegan chocolate chip cookies on a wire rack once you take them out the oven.

steps.title: Serve warm or put them in your cookie jar once they've cooled for later.
steps.content: Serve warm or put them in your cookie jar once they've cooled for later.

steps.title: Preheat the oven
steps.content: Preheat the oven to 400ºF/200ºC.

steps.title: Sift
steps.content: Sift and combine the flour, salt, baking powder, and baking soda together in a medium bowl.

steps.title: Use a mixer to cream the sugars and butter together in a large bowl.
steps.content: Use a mixer to cream the sugars and butter together in a large bowl.

steps.title: Combine the eggs, vanilla, and mashed bananas thoroughly in the butter mixture.
steps.content: Combine the eggs, vanilla, and mashed bananas thoroughly in the butter mixture.

steps.title: Add the flour mixture slowly to the butter mixture.
steps.content: Add the flour mixture slowly to the butter mixture. Mix thoroughly with a wooden spoon and add the chocolate chips in last.

steps.title: Place spoonfuls of the dough on a pre-greased or parchment paper layered cookie sheet.
steps.content: Place spoonfuls of the dough on a pre-greased or parchment paper layered cookie sheet.

steps.title: Bake the cookies for 12 to 15 minutes.
steps.content: Bake the cookies for 12 to 15 minutes.

steps.title: Cool completely on a cooling rack.
steps.content: Cool completely on a cooling rack.
